## Look at total handle

```{r}
sb_rev_month_df = read_csv('../data/legal_sports_report/sb_rev_by_month.csv')
state_legal_df = read_csv('../data/legal_sports_report/state_legalization_dates.csv')

get_n_states_legal = function(input_month) {
  n_states_legal = nrow(filter(state_legal_df, first_start <= input_month))
}

sb_rev_month_df = sb_rev_month_df |> 
  mutate(
    n_states_legal = sapply(month, get_n_states_legal)
  ) 

sb_rev_month_df |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = month, y=handle)) +
  geom_line() 

scale_factor = max(sb_rev_month_df$n_states_legal) / max(sb_rev_month_df$handle)

sb_rev_month_df |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = month)) +
  geom_line(aes(y=handle, color="handle")) +
  geom_line(aes(y=n_states_legal / scale_factor, color="legal")) +
  scale_y_continuous(
    name = "Handle",
    sec.axis = sec_axis(~ . * scale_factor, name="States Legal")
  )
```


## Look at total handle by state

```{r}
library(scales)

sb_rev_by_state_month = read_csv('data/legal_sports_report/sb_rev_by_state_month.csv')

#group by state and summing handles
handle_by_state = sb_rev_by_state_month |> 
  group_by(state) |> 
  summarise(total_handle = sum(handle, na.rm = TRUE))


handle_by_state |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = total_handle, y = reorder(state, total_handle))) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "lightblue") +
  scale_x_continuous(labels = comma) +
  labs(
    title = "Total Handle by State",
    x = "Total Handle",
    y = "State"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
  
```



## Look at monthly handle for top 5 states

```{r}
#pulling top 5 states
top_states = handle_by_state |> 
  arrange(desc(total_handle)) |> 
  head(5) |> 
  pull(state)

top_monthly_handle =
  sb_rev_by_state_month |> 
  filter(state %in% top_states)

top_monthly_handle |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = month, y = handle, color = state)) +
  geom_line(linewidth = 0.7) +
  labs(
    title = "Monthly Handle for Top 5 States",
    x = "Month",
    y = "Handle",
    color = "State"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()

  
```
